text: The M. hominis PCR assay had a clinical sensitivity and specificity of 90.7% (95% CI: 77.4%, 97.3%) and 99.2% (95% CI: 97.0%, 99.9%), respectively ( Table 3 ). The 6 discordant results were tested at the Albany Medical Center using an assay targeting the 16S ribosomal RNA gene; [12] both PCR positive/culturenegative specimens were PCR positive, and three of four PCR negative/culture-positive specimens were PCR negative.
